blogger before Jeffrey does. And I'm going to have to keep Dinah safe.

Jeffrey: Want some water? Some of those pills
the doctor gave us? You know, when you get better I'm going to give you hell.
How could you do something so stupid?
Dinah: I'm a girl.

Jeffrey: You've been assaulted twice now.
I'm starting to think that you like it. Be more careful.
Josh: Cassie?
Cassie: Hey.
Josh: What is that?
Cassie: It's just a little gift for you.
Josh: A drawer-knob?

Cassie: The whole drawer, actually. In case
you want to, you know, keep some things here when you stay over-- if you want.

Josh: Wow. What, are you kidding? Of
course... the whole drawer? The entire drawer?
Cassie: The entire drawer.
Josh: Just for me?
Cassie: (Laughs)
Josh: Thank you.
Cassie: So, did you see Reva?
Josh: Yeah. I want a beer.

Cassie: Wow. Okay. So was I wrong? Was it
some misunderstanding or I overreacted or something and she's fine?

Josh: No, actually you weren't wrong. There
was something going on. She was in trouble. Apparently she's racked up some
pretty serious gambling debts.
Cassie: Gambling?
Josh: Yeah.
Cassie: Wow. That's what she's messed up in?
Josh: Yeah, yeah. She got in over her head.

Cassie: Okay, so what are you going to do
about it?

Josh: Me? Nothing. Reva claims she can
handle it herself, and she doesn't want your help. She doesn't want my help.
Cassie: Is she still going away?

Josh: Yes, but she said she won't know where
she's going until she gets there.

Cassie: A-ha. So I guess I probably
shouldn't have asked you to go talk to her then, huh?

Josh: No, actually I'm glad you did because
now we know the truth. It's out in the open. So we can forget about Reva and we
can focus on us. Thank you for my drawer.
Cassie: You're welcome.

Reva: Dear Joshua, I'm writing this letter
because I don't want there to be anything left unsaid between us after I'm
gone. I want you to know even though we're not together anymore that you have
been my life, Bud. My heart and my soul. And your happiness and the happiness
of our children now and in the future is the most important thing in the world
to me. I respect and admire you so much. You're an amazing person, an amazing
man. You've given me more than I ever deserved and I'm grateful beyond words
that I got to spend so much of my life with you. And no matter what happens to
me, Joshua, you will always be the love of my life. That's how our story began
and that's how it will end. With love, always, Reva.
Next on "Guiding Light"...

Jonathan: Let's go. Let's run
like bunnies and stay out of my life, you hear me? I'm not like you. I would
never hurt my kid.
Nate: If you say so.

Lillian: And having a baby is the
greatest thing this that will ever happen in your life. You never ever turn
away even for a second when you're bathing a baby.

Nate: You don't belong in the
classroom, mate. Not with all those normal people.

Jonathan: No, you took care of
that. I'll never belong with normal people again.
